snippet: Environmentalists come to cities and see only loss and degradation. Developers come and see construction opportunities. In Torrey’s mountain mint, I saw hope.
abstract: Op-Ed article by urban conservation biologist Marielle Anzelone describes her heartbreak when a mall construction in Staten Island destroyed most of a small cluster of Torrey's mountain mint, a rare and globally imperiled wildflower, that had been found growing there.
lead_paragraph: Environmentalists come to cities and see only loss and degradation. Developers come and see construction opportunities. In Torrey’s mountain mint, I saw hope.

headline.seo: Mean Streets for Staten Island Mountain Mint
